creator: tomcatbug@prociss.co.uk
text:
When including a custom tag inside a JSP page that contains first regular 
JSP/HTML and is followed by a custom tag, the tag output is rendered first 
before the preceeding JSP content.

This bug is easily reproduced by creating a simple JSP custom tag that prints 
the word "Last" to the output writer. After creating the required descriptors 
and packaging. The follow JSP can be created and accessed...

<%@ page contentType="text/html; charset=UTF-8" %>
<%@ taglib uri="test" prefix="test" %>

<html>
    <head/>
    <body>
        First
        <test:SimpleOutputTag/>
    </body>
</html>

The resultant client-side page reads...

"Last First".
I cannot duplicate your problem.  Please attach a test cas.
creator: kin-man.chung@sun.com

text:
Created attachment 11813
War file demonstrating bug
creator: tomcatbug2@prociss.co.uk
tomcatbug2@prociss.co.uk
text:
The war file I have just attached to this record seems to demonstrate the bug. 
(Please ignore the project files (imr, ipr and iws) and the example.zip file.

Included in the war are 2 JSP pages, both of which include a custom tag that 
prints the message "LAST!" to the screen. 

The file withoutFlush.jsp (in root) demonstrates the bug. The file 
withFlush.jsp demonstrates a work-around where including a scriptlet to flush 
the output stream before the custom tag is reached resolves the problem.

creator: jan.luehe@sun.com
